        <div class="grid-container" id="main-content">
                            <div class="grid-x grid-margin-x">
    <div class="small-12 medium-12 large-9 cell">

        <div class="grid-x bg-white grid-padding-x grid-padding-y" style="width: 100%; position: relative;" itemtype="http://schema.org/Product" itemscope><div class="cell small-12" id="toptop"><h1 <div class="freeStarFragrantica" align="center" data-freestar-ad="__300x300" id="fragranticacom_perfume_incontent_1" v-pre>
</div></div></div><div class="grid-x grid-margin-x grid-margin-y"><div class="cell small-6"><likes-rating :perfume_id="6458" chart="show" type-chart="small-chart" colors="retro"></likes-rating></div><div class="cell small-6"><seasons-rating :perfume_id="6458" chart="show" type-chart="small-chart" colors="retro"></seasons-rating></div><div class="small-12 medium-6 text-center" style="max-height: 50px"><div itemprop="aggregateRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/AggregateRating" itemscope><p class="info-note">Perfume rating&nbsp;<span itemprop="ratingValue">4.14</span>&nbsp;out of&nbsp;<span itemprop="bestRating">5</span> with&nbsp;<span itemprop="ratingCount" content="12865">12,865</span> votes<meta itemprop="reviewCount" content="1095"/></p></div></div></div><div class="grid-x grid-margin-x grid-margin-y"><div class="cell small-12" itemprop="description" v-pre><p><b>Bal d'Afrique</b> by <b>Byredo</b> is a Oriental Woody fragrance for women and men. <b>Bal d'Afrique</b> was launched in 2009. The nose behind this fragrance is Jrme Epinette. Top notes are Amalfi Lemon, Marigold, Black Currant, Bergamot and African Orange Flower; middle notes are Violet, Cyclamen and Jasmine; base notes are Vetiver, Musk, Amber and Virginia Cedar. </p><div v-pre class='fragrantica-blockquote'><p>Stockholm-based niche line Byredo introduced a new fragrance named Bal dAfrique, which is"inspired by Paris in the late 1920'sand its infatuation with African culture, art, music, and dance.</p>

<p>This mix of Parisian avant-gardeand African culture shaped a unique and vibrant expression. The intense life, the excess and euphoria is illustrated by Bal d'Afrique's neroli, African marigold, and Moroccan cedarwood."</p>

<p>Top notes include: bergamot, lemon, neroli, African marigold, Bucchu. Middle notes include: violet, jasmine, and cyclamen. The base is composed of black amber, musk, vetiver, andMoroccan cedarwood.</p>

<p>The fragrance is available in 100 ml Eau de Parfum.</p></div><p class="reviewstrigger" style="font-size: smaller; color: #83a6c4">Read about this perfume in other languages: <a                     Subtle and less interesting after the top notes

                            <div class="cell small-12" style="display: inline-flex; margin: 0.4rem;word-wrap: break-word;padding: 0 0.6rem 0 0.6rem;">
                    <div class="fa-lg" style="display: flex; align-items: center; color: grey; cursor: pointer;">
                    <div style="display: inline-flex;">
                        <div class="vote-box-sp-ai">
                            <span>

                            <div class="num-votes-sp"><span style="font-size: 0.8rem;">30</span></div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="vote-box-sp-ai">
                             <span>
                            <i class="far fa-thumbs-down"></i>
                             </span>
                            <div class="num-votes-sp"><span style="font-size: 0.8rem;">84</span></div>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                    </div>
                    Does not work for those who dislike woods or fruits
                </div>
                            <div class="cell small-12" style="display: inline-flex; margin: 0.4rem;word-wrap: break-word;padding: 0 0.6rem 0 0.6rem;">
                    <div class="fa-lg" style="display: flex; align-items: center; color: grey; cursor: pointer;">
                    <div style="display: inline-flex;">
                        <div class="vote-box-sp-ai">
                            <span>

                        </div>
                        <div class="vote-box-sp-ai">
                             <span>
                            <i class="far fa-thumbs-down"></i>
                             </span>
                            <div class="num-votes-sp"><span style="font-size: 0.8rem;">154</span></div>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                    </div>
                    Drydown is boring, soapy, and generic
                </div>
                            <div class="cell small-12" style="display: inline-flex; margin: 0.4rem;word-wrap: break-word;padding: 0 0.6rem 0 0.6rem;">
                    <div class="fa-lg" style="display: flex; align-items: center; color: grey; cursor: pointer;">
                    <div style="display: inline-flex;">

                    </div>
                    Not enjoyable if you don't like fruity or blackcurrant notes
                </div>

background: white;"><div class="strike-title"><span>Perfume Pyramid</span></div><pyramid-switch :perfume_id="6458"><pyramid-notes title="Main Notes According to Your Votes"></pyramid-notes><h4 style="margin-top: 0.5rem"><b>Top Notes</b></h4><pyramid-level notes="top"><div style="display: flex; height: 1rem;"></like><span class="show-for-medium">Positive Reviews</span></a></li><li class="tabs-title"><a href="#popular-negative-reviews"><svg class="menu hide-for-medium" style="width: 1rem; height: 1rem;display: inline-block" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" viewBox="0 0 24 24" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-width="2" d="M7 8h10M7 12h4m1 8l-4-4H5a2 2 0 01-2-2V6a2 2 0 012-2h14a2 2 0 012 2v8a2 2 0 01-2 2h-3l-4 4z"></path></svg><dislike style="width: 1rem; height: 1rem;"></dislike><span class="show-for-medium">Negative Reviews</span></a></li><li class="tabs-title"><a href="#search-reviews"><svg class="menu hide-for-medium" style="width: 1rem; height: 1rem;display: inline-block" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" viewBox="0 0 24 24" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-width="2" d="M7 8h10M7 12h4m1 8l-4-4H5a2 2 0 01-2-2V6a2 2 0 012-2h14a2 2 0 012 2v8a2 2 0 01-2 2h-3l-4 4z"></path></svg><i class="fas fa-search"></i><span class="show-for-medium">Search</span></a></li></ul><reviews-wrapper><div class="tabs-content" data-tabs-content="deeplinked-tabs"><div class="tabs-panel is-active" id="all-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>All Reviews By Date</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
        <div class="cell destinationreview"></div>                    <div id="parent2350046" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2350046" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="colorfulmess"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1047543"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1047543.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="colorfulmess" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jo-Malone-London/Orange-Bitters-41360.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.41360.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Orange Bitters"title="Orange Bitters"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2350046ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2350046" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1047543">colorfulmess</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-11-15">11/15/24 11:05</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>At first, it reminded me of Royal Muska, but then I quickly became immune and couldn't smell it anymore, even after a new spray. Too subtle and undetectable for me!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2350046"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2350046#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2349841" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2349841" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="KimLilly"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/825496"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.825496.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="KimLilly" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Roja-Dove/Elixir-Pour-Femme-Essence-De-Parfum-53131.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.53131.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Elixir Pour Femme Essence De Parfum"title="Elixir Pour Femme Essence De Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2349841ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2349841" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/825496">KimLilly</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-11-15">11/15/24 07:30</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Frankly, I wasn't expecting much from this perfume according to its notes, but the hype got me curious.<br />
The first spray was an inexplicable experience for me. It took me back to my childhood immediately, because the opening reminded me of a kid's perfume I had, Babar from Shao Ko (https://www.fragrantica.com.br/perfume/Shao-Ko/Babar-79264.html)  and I simply don't know why, since they don't share any notes. I didn't even remember I had this until the first spray... I was assaulted by a nostalgia that almost brought me to tears. Because of that, I instantly fell in love with Bal D'Afrique <br />
I can't particularly smell any specific note. Yet, this perfume has a lot of nuances  citrusy, fruity, woody, musky. It's more citrusy in the opening and more woody in the dry-down, however, each sniff reveals a different facet while this fragrance lasts. The fruitiness isn't overly sweet or feminine, and the woodiness isn't overly dry or masculine. It's not super fresh, nor super cozy. It's perfectly balanced, unisex, classic, elegant, and timeless. Unique, it has personality. Definitely a masterpiece.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2349841"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2349841#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2348677" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2348677" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="CHESTDAYBABY"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1658356"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1658356.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="CHESTDAYBABY" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Astre/Luminoir-96821.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.96821.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Luminoir"title="Luminoir"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2348677ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2348677" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1658356">CHESTDAYBABY</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-11-14">11/14/24 07:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>your classic eau de cologne style fragrance.<br />
<br />
citruses, white florals, &amp; aromatics.<br />
<br />
it smells delightful and unbelievably easy to wear.<br />
<br />
not a high performer despite its price, thats how it be sometimes.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2348677"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2348677#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2347181" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2347181" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Banele"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1725150"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Banele" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2347181ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2347181" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1725150">Banele</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-11-12">11/12/24 23:39</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>To me it smells lile a fresher version of musk therapy from Initio. <br />
I smell the cassis, lemon and musk and the woodiness ist more amplified than in musk therapy other than that theyre very similar to my nose. <br />
So if you dont like the creaminess and milkiness of musk therapy go with this one.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2347181"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2347181#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2343580" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2343580" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Kendralh"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2289727"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Kendralh" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2343580ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2343580" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2289727">Kendralh</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-11-09">11/09/24 15:27</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Hot black tea with a lemon wedge, but like if you were drinking it at an outdoor wedding-- woodsy and floral undertones. <br />
<br />
I think this is a true unisex-- sometimes it leans masculine because of the cedar, and sometimes it leans feminine because of the amber. Overall it's very versatile and sexy, but not overtly. It wouldn't be inappropriate for an office, but I think it would be perfect for a dinner date. <br />
<br />
It stays relatively close to the skin (1 ft?) but as another reviewer mentioned, that feels like a feature rather than a mistake-- it would be overwhelming if it projected more. It's intimate and inviting rather than being weak.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2343580"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2343580#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.8); padding: 0; border: none; margin: 0;"><!-- Tag ID: fragranticacom_perfume_incontent_6 -->

padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2335709" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="makinmagic1"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2161286"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2161286.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="makinmagic1" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Montale/Mukhallat-3241.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.3241.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Mukhallat"title="Mukhallat"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2335709ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2335709" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2161286">makinmagic1</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-11-02">11/02/24 11:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Tangy lemon, cassis, and vetiver. Very feminine in my opinion, yet not sweet and has no detectable florals. Light, close to the skin perfume, delicate like a whisper, and it's lousy projection kind of makes sense and is a feature, not a bug, if it was louder, it would be too much. I do like it quite a bit, just not enough to buy a full bottle.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2335709"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2335709#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2332392" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2332392" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="000.rla"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1711702"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1711702.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="000.rla" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jo-Malone-London/English-Pear-Freesia-10314.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.10314.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="English Pear & Freesia"title="English Pear & Freesia"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2332392ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2332392" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1711702">000.rla</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-30">10/30/24 06:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>this is very, very lemon. it is a sweet, tart lemon scent, with fruity notes in the background. bal dafrique is pretty linear, which i dont mind. however, this fragrance has the worst lasting power among fragrances that i own. i tested it on my arm wearing a hoodie, and 2 hours later i could not smell anything left. i usually dont care about lasting power because i dont mind re-applying, but this one disappeared way too quick. thankfully, i only bought a decant  but i definitely wouldnt buy a full bottle.<br />
<br />
edit: btw, for those who is interested in the scent and wants a dupe, the rare beauty body mist is a good option. the lasting power might be about the same as bal dafrique too lol</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2332392"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2332392#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2329661" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2329661" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="wags"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2173332"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="wags" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2329661ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2329661" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2173332">wags</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-27">10/27/24 18:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This one is a real mood lifter for me. I feel blanketed in a warm, gentle, clean, and comforting scent. Super versatile and androgynous scent. Its a great scent for someone who typically doesnt wear fragrance, but may want to smell wonderful on a special occasion. <br />
<br />
This is not for the person looking to attract others with a large and abrasive scent trail. Its meant to be discovered and enjoyed within close proximity. The person actually wearing the scent will enjoy it the most. Hope anyone who purchases enjoys it as much as I do. Happy Holidays.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2329661"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2329661#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2327477" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2316669" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Ferg1"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1291437"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1291437.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Ferg1" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2316669ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2316669" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.79); padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2312730" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="eliegg"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2249908"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="eliegg" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2312730ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2312730" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2249908">eliegg</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-11">10/11/24 17:56</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Bal d'afrique by Byredo is happiness and nostalgia in a bottle. This fragrance is so beautiful and easy to wear. It has a very distinct and instantly recognizable tart sweetness and citrus opening with deeper woodsier notes appearing later on. Could not recommend this masterpiece enough. Somewhat masculine yet still unisex. One of the best fragrances of all time in my opinion. Love love love love love.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2312730"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2312730#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2309571" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Leccin aprendida, todos tenemos olfato muy diferente!!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2309571"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2309571#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2309286" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2309286" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="byrehoe"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1577248"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1577248.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="byrehoe" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Byredo/Mojave-Ghost-27040.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.27040.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Mojave Ghost"title="Mojave Ghost"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2309286ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2309286" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1577248">byrehoe</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-08">10/08/24 15:56</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Bald Freak she is not, as this is the scent of the most luscious hair I can imagine. Most people seem to brand BdA a citrus, but to my nose she smells like an artisanal shampoo made of marigold blossoms. Bright, zesty, complex, with a cosmetic-y core. Like the scent of a celebrity after being gussied by an elite beauty team. However, I feel like she could complement wearers of any age, in any season. Astute reviewer @heliotrope72 said it smelled like a type-A person on vacation, and yup, I see it. I've never smelled anything else quite like BdA. She will probably be the next Byredo I buy a full bottle of because I'm on my fifth tester vial. Lifespan is, alas, mid. The things we do for the beautiful <br />
<br />
Mental Snapshot: The morning starts with an argan oil deep tissue massage, followed by a cocoa butter Lomi Lomi. Every cuticle is caressed, every lock coaxed into skeins of silk. As you recline in your chair, youre primped, powdered, spritzed, styled, and maybe even titivated. Youve never been Photoshopped. Not when you look this good. <br />
<br />
tl;dr: A-list salon </p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2309286"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2309286#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2308583" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2308583" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sarahcake22"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2280028"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="sarahcake22" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2308583ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2308583" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2280028">sarahcake22</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-08">10/08/24 02:25</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I used up my bottle. My thoughts: This needs to be in an extrait version, or I won't ever purchase it again. The longevity is a joke. The scent, being 'fresh' is unrivaled because of that transformative, three-dimensional quality it has, many freshies are unable to do even a bit of that. It switches from clean, warm, sexy, juicy all in one spray experience. Yeah Brilliant scent but no way will I repurchase because of the appalling longevity. 2 hours is its maximum</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2308583"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2308583#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2308069" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2308069" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="gardeniapetunia"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/82848"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.82848.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="gardeniapetunia" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.6458.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bal d'Afrique"title="Bal d'Afrique"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2308069ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2308069" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/82848">gardeniapetunia</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-07">10/07/24 13:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I ordered a travel spray based on the reviews and this is the best thing I've smelled in a long time. It takes me what seems like forever to find something that is full bottle worthy and I've already bought it. It's beautiful, calming and a smooth blend of notes. I want to breathe it in And there's no question if I love it or not. I didn't have to try it for 3 days wondering.<br />
The downside, it doesn't last long. That's okay. It's not great but it has the best opening I think of any perfume I have smelled. <br />
It's expensive bah humbug. Oh well. It's still affordable if I look around and I'm never going to spend $300 plus on a bottle of perfume. I wouldn't value any perfume that much.<br />
I have been known to squander plenty on blind buys although not much anymore, and cheapies although I don't do that either too much, I'm trying to hold out for the things I really really want and this is one of them.<br />
Okay an update. I recently got a bottle from eBay. It was not cheap but it was cheaper. Too cheap LOL $130 it's fake and I have filed a claim and I will get my money back.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2308069"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2308069#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2306863" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2306863" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="rylai"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/67827"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.67827.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="rylai" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/The-Merchant-of-Venice/La-Fenice-Pour-Femme-42399.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.42399.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="La Fenice Pour Femme"title="La Fenice Pour Femme"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2306863ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2306863" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/67827">rylai</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-06">10/06/24 11:14</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>this perfume was given to me as a gift by my swedish friend. the opening is quite citrusy, then it makes a quick transition to a violet scent, then it goes into a musky scent. the musk tone in this perfume is a bit animalic for me, but still the scent is quite fresh and clean. there is nothing similar to other fragrances, so it is very unique. it just disappears very quickly :/</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2306863"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2306863#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2306578" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2306578" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Forelsket"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1455469"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1455469.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Forelsket" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2306578ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2306578" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1455469">Forelsket</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-06">10/06/24 05:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>After having heard so much about this perfume I was really excited to try it; and I wasn't disappointed. It's a "soft symphony" of colours, sounds and scents. Very nice. "Nice" is the word I would use to describe Byredo, which can mean whatever you want I suppose.<br />
<br />
Bal d'Afrique smelled oddly familiar so I had to dig into my memory (and my drawers) and I found its close cousin: L'Eclat from Rituals. Now I can't "unsmell" it. They don't have any notes in common (maybe neroli) so I don't know where the ressemblance comes from, but some people have also noted it.<br />
<br />
Edit 2 weeks later: Ive tried Bal dAfrique several times and I like it a little less now. Its too sweet, too sugary. I could wear it during cold days in winter, but its too sweet for me when the weather is nice. <br />
<br />
I dont know why I now find this perfume too sweet and quite long lasting (!), maybe my nose is more sensitive these days :D</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2306578"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2306578#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2303337" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; When i first smelt this, it smelt like the calming waves in the afternoon at the beach. I have bought it and can say I'm happy with this purchase. To me right now, it smells sweet, fresh with sunscreen.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2303337"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2303337#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2302518" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; It's bright, yet balmy. Perfect for everyday use, yet so special. My comfort blanket.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2302518"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2302518#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2300245" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2014858">curlycomedy</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-30">09/30/24 11:42</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>For some reason I get wafts of licorice or anise. I only have a tiny decant with a dabbing stick, and I removed the stick to insert a spray atomizer. I got more of it on than usual, but I worry I am not getting an accurate understanding of what this offers. It does not stay in the memory. I would categorize it as fresh. Because of the limited application I cant speak the longevity or sillage. Just the scent is nice, lemony-licorice and fresh.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2300245"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2300245#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2300215" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2300215" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="darkforestmags"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1170902"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1170902.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="darkforestmags" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Giardini-Di-Toscana/Bianco-Latte-64757.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.64757.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bianco Latte"title="Bianco Latte"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2300215ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2300215" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1170902">darkforestmags</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-30">09/30/24 11:16</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This may be just a bit too fruity for me. I imagined this being a bit darker floral than I'm getting; it's almost a little tropical? Like I'm getting pineapple here, *how*? Pina colada type sweetness. The middle calms down a little bit but that pineapple persists... this may have too many competing hot weather notes for me. It's well done but just not in my wheelhouse. <br />
<br />
Okay, okay the middle is getting a little more sophisticated. Very bright and clean, well blended. Now that this rogue pineapple situation is less in the foreground, I can understand a bit better where it's trying to go. The depth develops; the brightness is still there, but it's much more balanced with the deeper notes. I've definitely smelled this around before. It's hard for me to believe there's no vanilla in this? Just getting random ass notes at this point.<br />
<br />
Alright, 45 minutes later I'm about this Bal d'Afrique life now, I can hack it, but man those top notes made me feel unstable. Will be filing this away for next summer.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2300215"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2300215#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2298887" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2298464" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="introvertedboi"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2269885"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="introvertedboi" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2298464ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2298464" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.76); Not overly floral but super sweet nonetheless, and not fruity at all which is strange. The true definition of diabetes for your nose. It's authentically sweet but not from any fruits or flowers, it's like the sweetness came from the flower's nectar. But I love it!<br />
Longevity and projecting is quite disappointing but the sweetness made up for it. I still think the price was a bit high but I can't get enough of that sweetness.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2298464"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2298464#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2298434" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2293470" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="OneEyedOdin"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2253036"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="OneEyedOdin" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2293470ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2293470" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2253036">OneEyedOdin</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-24">09/24/24 07:06</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Beautiful dark floral scent. Reminds me of luxury soap. Wish it lasted longer though. Its barely detectable on skin after two hours. Ill use up my travel spray but I dont think I can justify the price of a full bottle.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2293470"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2293470#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2293410" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Clean, a bit creamy that reminds me of fancy hotel lobby. The citrus and sweet notes are so well balanced and its such a comfy smell. It wouldve been a perfect perfume if it lasted more than 2h . Its too weak and  that hurts me . So if youre rich and you can finish half of the bottle in a day and you dont mind repurchasing it over and over again, its a great choice.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2278962" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="viez"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1716159"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1716159.gif" class="comments-avatar"alt="viez" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2278962ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2278962" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1716159">viez</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-11">09/11/24 05:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The other day I came across a tall man who looked scandanavian and wore a really nice suit. Each time he was in my proximity I was getting whiffs of what Im 99% sure was Bal dAfrique (I own a decant of it). <br />
<br />
Theres an old adage in the fragrance community which goes something like this: a fragrance alone wont make you attractive, but it can certainly help if youve done everything else right. <br />
<br />
In that sense, Bal dAfrique complimented this man exceptionally well. I dont think its a scent which on its own will blow anyone away - but when you come across it on someone else it does just have this alluring quality to it. It conveys cleanliness in the best way possible .</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2278962"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2278962#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2278919" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2276545" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="orestes13"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1325551"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1325551.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="orestes13" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2276545ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2276545" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1325551">orestes13</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-09">09/09/24 01:09</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Very soft woody/citrus/floral perfume that leaves a lot to be desired. I get mostly cedar and musk (and Hedione, lol). Florals and citruses are there too but are somewhat muted. As for fruity notes, I only get the slightest bit of blackcurrant. I can only recommend this for summer (due to performance issues) and for occasions when you want to wear something light and inoffensive.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2276545"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2276545#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2273405" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1687098">athpolitou</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-06">09/06/24 04:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I've been wearing this for a few hours today, and I have to say it is not to my liking unfortunately. I was expecting something more fresh and woody based off the notes, but there's a creamy/lotiony aspect to it which leans heavy on the musk. It reminds me a lot of  Zadig &amp; Voltaire This is Her, which I do not like. I get how some people can find it "comforting" like a blanket, but the muskiness adds a heaviness which makes it almost "musty" to my nose.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2273405"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2273405#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2272840" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2272840" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ClaireSav101"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2244563"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2244563.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ClaireSav101" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2272840ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2272840" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2244563">ClaireSav101</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-05">09/05/24 14:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I just bought a bottle of Bal DAfrique after smelling it on a colleague. This is my first review on here, I dont have the vocab of a professional perfumer, but I can tell you this scent is beautiful. I saw other reviews saying its a perfect summer scent, which I agree with, but I think it will transition well into the autumn months also. To me it smells warm, comforting and sophisticated. It reminds me very much of Zadig &amp; Voltaire This is Her which I can only put down to the jasmine notes both scents have in common. Im currently wearing as a daytime fragrance. It lasts a fairly long on my skin and I can smell it on myself when I swish my hair. I am female, but can see why this is a unisex fragrance. I hope this helps anyone who might be blind buying this expensive scent xx</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2272840"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2272840#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2271978" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2271978" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Bordo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1276236"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1276236.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Bordo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Gallagher-Fragrances/Wicked-Good-53950.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.53950.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Wicked Good"title="Wicked Good"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2271978ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2271978" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1276236">Bordo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-04">09/04/24 22:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Creamy and clean (even fresh) woody + citrusy scent. Smell like you are well put together. I totally get the hype, it is unique, wearable and pretty. However performance to me is lacking. It last a few hours and a scent bubble is rather small. But once again, if it was louder, perhaps it would loose part of its' charm? After all, not all perfumes need to aim to be loudest in the market. However the body lotion of this scent is amazing, it last super well, much better than the perfume and smells just perfect and expensive, and a bit like a spa.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2271806" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="alexoxoxo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1718525"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="alexoxoxo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2271806ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2271806" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1718525">alexoxoxo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-04">09/04/24 17:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>With the first spray, my initial thought was "I think I've found my signature scent" and as someone that has many scents in their collection, I NEVER thought I'd feel this way. It's honestly perfect - fresh, airy, creamy, but still feminine and soft. It's so unique, I don't have anything else like this in my collection and I think it balances floral, fresh, and woody scent profiles so well.<br />
<br />
If you are looking for a dupe, Phlur's Father Figure is very similar IMO, but definitely not a clone.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2271806"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2271806#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2270982" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; So well blended. So versatile, suits any kind of occasion, truly unisex. I like to wear it most in the summer months. <br />
<br />
Wasn't love at first sniff, I had a few samples and it gradually became one of my favourites. Lasts longer than any of the other Byredo scents i've tried.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2270982"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2270982#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2270488" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
