I dont find it to be worth all the hype, but Ill enjoy my decant until its finished! Just a tad underwhelming for me and my preferences, but its still lovely!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2200631"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2200631#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2192880" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2192880" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="tine182"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2105287"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2105287.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="tine182" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2192880ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2192880" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2105287">tine182</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-19">06/19/24 05:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>For a long time I thought that Byredo's line just wasn't for me! I had done a lot of sniffing in shop and even had a few samples, but it wasn't until I tried Bal D'afrique that I understood the love for Byredo! It is still the only fragrance from them that I own, but I really, really love it. <br />
It's fresh and 'clean' in scent but not soapy or powder-y at all (to me). I do also find it REALLY sticks on the skin, 8+ hours for me, without being over powering, which is what I look for in my fresh scents. I'm not sure I could even pick out specific notes on first or fifth smell but it's just lovely. As the hours go on, the citrus has really dissipated and you're left with a fresh, slightly sweet, skin-like floral &amp; amber-ness. I do think Byredo is all very overpriced, however, I will continue to buy this because I've never smelled anything that's truly comparable.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2192880"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2192880#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2191137" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2191137" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="L&#039;&eacute;gyptienne"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1595463"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1595463.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="L&#039;&eacute;gyptienne" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Celine/Parade-57918.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.57918.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Parade"title="Parade"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2191137ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2191137" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1595463">L&#039;&eacute;gyptienne</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-17">06/17/24 13:33</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>An easy going fragrance.<br />
You wake up one day and you have the desire to smell a citrus clean note, espesially if you know it's toohot and humid outside....Et voil! you choose Bal d'afrique .<br />
Soft projection and longetivity is limited on the skin but can reach 10 hrs on the clothes.<br />
A secret; it faint easily on cold weather, so it's ur best friend on summer and spring.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2191137"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2191137#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2186806" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2186806" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="tanyako"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2157267"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2157267.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="tanyako" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2186806ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2186806" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2157267">tanyako</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-13">06/13/24 04:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Reminds me of the Egyptian oil perfume secrets of the desert which had citrus fruits, jasmine and a hint of sweet pineapple.  I bought this decades ago on a trip and still have the bottle. <br />
Bal dafrique is a weaker and more refined version of it, more subtle and complex but they are definitely cousins. Might be an interesting layering combo.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2186806"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2186806#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2186804" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2186804" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="favst"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2158733"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2158733.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="favst" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Comme-des-Garcons/Comme-des-Garcons-Series-3-Incense-Avignon-1230.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1230.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Comme des Garcons Series 3 Incense: Avignon"title="Comme des Garcons Series 3 Incense: Avignon"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2186804ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2186804" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2158733">favst</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-13">06/13/24 04:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>There is something really comforting about this fragrance that makes me gravitate towards it.<br />
Its fresh, lemony and clean, a little woody, a little earthy, a little creamy, and really unisex to wear. Its light hearted and uncomplicated, refined but unpretentious.<br />
Longevity and projection are plain weak... Even when also using Bal d'Afriques body lotion you need to POUR it on, rather than spritz lightly.<br />
Anyway, its one of my June/July favorites.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2186804"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2186804#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2184660" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Something about this keeps me wanting more. The scent doesnt evolve much beyond first spray, but it is lovely nonetheless; a good skin scent. I found this lasted longer on my clothes than on my skin.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2183396"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2183396#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2181131" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; As for the opening of this scent, it's super fresh, reminds me of a summer vacation somewhere like greece or spain in a newly freshly cleaned hotel room or apartment.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2175252" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="vminie"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2128906"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="vminie" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2175252ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2175252" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2128906">vminie</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-02">06/02/24 00:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Smells like lemon rind with a bit of bergamot at the onset but the black currant was stronger on me. It dissipates into this subtle barely-there amber that sat too close on my skin I could barely tell if I am smelling my skin or the perfume. I guess that's a nice quality to it? I can see why it might be appealing because it gives off an illusion that your skin smells so good on its own . But also, way overpriced? For a skin but better kind of scent I'd rather go for Glossier You which is at a lower price and has more distinctive qualities to it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2173412" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Shanty36"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1921076"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Shanty36" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-Neige-56737.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.56737.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Soleil Neige"title="Soleil Neige"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2173412ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2173412" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1921076">Shanty36</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-31">05/31/24 08:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a lovely fragrance. Casual, uplifting and easy to wear. Perfect for late spring and summer. Its a lovely citrus, floral bomb. And I get a buttery note, which must be from one of the flower notes that Im less familiar with. The longevity is average for this type of fragrance, which means not great BUT better than Gypsy water. Not sure if its worth the crazy amount of hype but I do find it good.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2173412"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2173412#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2171329" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2171329" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Dee97"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1130719"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Dee97" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2171329ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2171329" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1130719">Dee97</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-29">05/29/24 08:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is beautiful  fresh and tropical smelling, but gives off this expensive hotel soap vibe. Even though theyre not listed, I smell coconut and pineapple. This would be perfect for when youre going out on a summers evening or even just for everyday when you want to smell clean but still want to make an effort. Its not the most longest lasting perfume in the world, but I layer with the matching body lotion so I get a good 5-6 hours which is more than fine with me as I dont wear it everyday. Is it worth the price? I think it could be a little cheaper for what it is but its still a beautiful scent. My friend hugged me and said mmm you smell so good so its definitely a compliment getter.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2171329"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2171329#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2170109" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2170109" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="eaudetoilette"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2066854"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="eaudetoilette" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/When-the-Rain-Stops-70985.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.70985.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="When the Rain Stops"title="When the Rain Stops"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2170109ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2170109" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2066854">eaudetoilette</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-28">05/28/24 06:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Pleasant and soapy with a tropical fruity aspect. Has a sunscreen/really expensive lotion kind of vibe to it, and I, among others, was surprised it has no coconut note listed. It conjures vivid memories of a holiday i had in miami: maybe they sprayed it in the hotel or something? Really nice fragrance, in my top 3 for byredo.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2170109"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2170109#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2167759" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2167759" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Muffin00"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1916746"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Muffin00" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2167759ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2167759" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1916746">Muffin00</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-25">05/25/24 15:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Agreed that this has a very pleasant soapy, creamy cleanliness, and I really like the violet in this one -- it smells modern, not fusty.  Trouble is, it's gone with the wind! My skin kind of sucks up fragrance in general, but this one was particularly ephemeral.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2167759"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2167759#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2166909" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2166909" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="GracieLions"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1821289"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1821289.gif" class="comments-avatar"alt="GracieLions" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Byredo/Mojave-Ghost-27040.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.27040.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Mojave Ghost"title="Mojave Ghost"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2166909ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2166909" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1821289">GracieLions</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-24">05/24/24 15:57</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This perfume smells so clean! I'm surprised aldehydes aren't mentioned in its notes because - to me - that's the key scent. It's an interesting perfume that doesn't necessarily smell anything floral or citrusy, just very soapy. However, there's a musk in it that is quite addictive, and it's not like anything I've smelled before. Very pleasant. From what I've learned, Marilyn Monroe would have liked this perfume.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2166909"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2166909#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2165451" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2165451" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="butterflybrat"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2139592"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2139592.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="butterflybrat" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Fine-ry/Not-Another-Cherry-79167.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.79167.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Not Another Cherry"title="Not Another Cherry"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2165451ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2165451" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2139592">butterflybrat</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-23">05/23/24 10:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Such a pleasant and nuanced citrus scent - haven't smelled anything like it. Very versatile, but I prefer it for daytime, especially after a morning shower. Not because I think it smells soapy or shampoo-y, but because it's clean and energizing with some added creaminess from the vetiver. It's office appropriate and will get you a lot of "oh wow, you smell nice" compliments from those near you, but not from afar. Longevity isn't the best either, which is unfortunate considering the price, but that seems to be typical for most frags I've tried!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2165451"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2165451#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2163979" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2163979" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="VeuveLove"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1369439"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="VeuveLove" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lattafa-Perfumes/Mohra-78382.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.78382.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Mohra"title="Mohra"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2163979ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2163979" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1369439">VeuveLove</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-22">05/22/24 04:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This reminds me of Isabella Rosselini Manifesto from early 2000. Fresh and zingy. If it was edible it'd be a Gin &amp; Tonic with a slice of lime. Cannot see this offending anybody. Lovely light summer scent. Keeper.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2163979"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2163979#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2163575" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2163575" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="LaMiaRosa"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1313563"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1313563.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="LaMiaRosa" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Coffee-Break-55926.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.55926.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Coffee Break"title="Coffee Break"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2163575ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2163575" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1313563">LaMiaRosa</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-21">05/21/24 16:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This smells almost identical to Prada's Infusion d'Iris, the original version. To me it smells like you've just gotten out of the shower after using some very expensive and lavish soap. Citrusy, soapy, floral and woody, especially in the drydown. Although this doesn't change much from opening to drydown. I can't pick out many individual notes, this just smells well-rounded, clean and expensive. Longevity is good too. <br />
<br />
If I had to describe this scent with imagery, it would be the sun filtering through a glass window pane while you're showering in the morning. Soapy and sudsy. Optimistic. Happy. That part of a summer or spring morning where it's neither cold nor hot, just perfectly mild, but you know it's going to be hot later. You're at peace, perfectly content, yet confident at the same time, because you know you have everything you could ever need and nothing and no one can hurt you.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2163575"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2163575#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2160797" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2160797"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2160797#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2158129" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2158129" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="vladravenstein"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1857172"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1857172.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="vladravenstein" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Kayali-Fragrances/Vanilla-28-52616.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.52616.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Vanilla 28"title="Vanilla 28"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2158129ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2158129" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.73); Suitable for both cold and warm season. Easy to layer with other fragrances, a must have for a fresh perfume collection.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2158129"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2158129#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2155905" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; And whats the fuzz about projection and longivity?? Super strong on my skin, and stays better than many other freshies. Dont listen to that crap and try it your self. 10/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2155905"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2155905#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2155619" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Wouldn't recommend paying full retail though especially with how short it lasts at least for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2155619"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2155619#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2151341" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; It reminds me of a smell I'd expect on a kindergarden teacher.  It has that nearly skin-scent but powdery smell from Initio Rehab, but in a more feminine form.  I'm not so inexperienced as to equate anything powdery with baby wipes, for instance, but this one really does evoke a feminine product type of smell.  In the deeper drydown a slight citrus woody profile emerges which I prefer.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2151341"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2151341#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2151094" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; I have re-bought it like 5 times. It was my every day perfume for many years and I used to get so many compliments from wearing it. To me its not super sweet, its light, warm, fruity and fresh. I have a sensitive nose and this doesnt get me nauseous  the dry down is absolutely stunning. Longevity is good, not the best but good. Perfect for every day and hot summer nights!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2149353"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2149353#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2147685" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2147685" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="1annie.beth"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1862342"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1862342.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="1annie.beth" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/By-Rosie-Jane/Rosie-52177.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.52177.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Rosie"title="Rosie"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2147685ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2147685" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1862342">1annie.beth</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-06">05/06/24 14:16</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Bal d'Afrique is a delicious, addictive scent that I find myself wanting to reach for more often than I expected. The lemon, violet, and vetiver stand out the most to me. As it dries down it almost smells like lemon and violet-flavored candies; warm, sweet, and fruity-floral.<br />
<br />
All that said, this scent is barely there even right after applying, and it disappears completely from my skin and clothes within 2 hours. And that was the perfume oil, not the EDP. I purchased Oakcha's impression (Gold Gem) for $40 and it's almost spot on with better performance. I could never justify purchasing the real thing.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2147685"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2147685#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2143659" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2143180" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jcp1612"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1967483"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="jcp1612" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2143180ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2143180" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.86); align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2143180"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2143180#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2141761" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2141761" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="asoolsakania"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2115395"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="asoolsakania" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2141761ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2141761" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2115395">asoolsakania</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-30">04/30/24 22:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The fragrance exudes a clean scent with a harmonious blend of woody, floral, and coconut undertones, which effectively balance out any citrusy chemical notes. It's undeniably pretty and boasts excellent longevity, lasting all day. However, for me, it falls into the category of "like" rather than "love."</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2141761"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2141761#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2141192" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2141192" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Frangipanilove"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/528960"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.528960.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Frangipanilove" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/Aqua-Vitae-Forte-31404.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31404.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Aqua Vitae Forte"title="Aqua Vitae Forte"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2141192ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2141192" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/528960">Frangipanilove</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-30">04/30/24 10:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Its delicious. Dominated by the happy marigold/tagetes, on top of a colourful, happy, citrusy  ambery musky woody base - it is dancing in deep golden sunlight glimmering over orange and blue and fuchsia coloured wowen baskets, late afternoon sun, childrens laughter, music from the distance and soft fragrance of the warm air reaching you. Bal d Afrique is very lovely and quite unique. Poor longevity sadly - you have to keep re-spraying which at this (over)price point becomes, well, pricy. Its been a long time Ive been this intrigued by a fragrance though - the balance of tagetes with the other notes really tickles me in the best possible way!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2141192"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2141192#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2137145" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2137145" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="BandmanMrBandman"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2081102"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2081102.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="BandmanMrBandman" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/M-Micallef/EdenFalls-65939.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.65939.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="EdenFalls"title="EdenFalls"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2137145ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2137145" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2081102">BandmanMrBandman</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-26">04/26/24 10:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Bal dAfrique was a fragrance that completely unimpressed me at first as another overpriced freshie but managed to captivate me in the end. The opening is a burst of fresh, soapy citrus mixed with aromatic florals that makes this smell so pleasing and familiar, like a really nice body wash or fabric softener. It is fairly linear too, becoming less fresh and more woodier with the vetiver becoming prominent in the dry down. On skin, it seems to last around 3-4 hours and a day on clothes and doesnt seem to project that much off of my arms, but was happily able to smell it the whole time so maybe its just more intimate.  Bal dAfrique is a unique and invigorating freshie that I could see myself wear as a dumb spray for the day year-round, but it is kinda pricy for what it is. Definitely wouldnt blind buy as you might be disappointed in the smell or performance and is pretty expensive, but it is hard for me not to love it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2137145"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2137145#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2136268" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2136268" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Ginda"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2099912"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2099912.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Ginda" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2136268ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2136268" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2099912">Ginda</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-25">04/25/24 13:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have just bought a full bottle after sampling the discovery set. Of all the Byredo scents I tried this was by far my favourite. <br />
<br />
It is tropical and fruity, but pulls it off in a way that is not childish or overly sweet. I feel that this would work all year round. For me the scent that settled on my skin was like the perfect fig, which isn't actually a note. After puzzling over this for a while I figured that what I must be smelling is the violet and it made perfect sense suddenly. I love love love it and can't wait to wear all summer</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2136268"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2136268#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2134992" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2134992" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Ajlis"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2074474"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2074474.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Ajlis" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Le-Labo/The-Noir-29-31872.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31872.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The Noir 29"title="The Noir 29"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2134992ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2134992" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2074474">Ajlis</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-24">04/24/24 10:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A pungent, artificially soapy, suffocating scent that reminds me of an overly potent car freshener  one that triggers motion sickness. I can't tell which ingredient in this fragrance is so repulsive to me, but each whiff induces nausea and a looming headache. Sometimes I wonder if there is something wrong with my nose because so many people seem to love this perfume. But I've found that I don't like Byredo's other fragrances either  something in their DNA doesn't suit me. (Gypsy Water is the only Byredo I've liked so far.)  I'm surprised by the reviews that say this perfume is light and fleeting, to my nose it's really strong and long lasting. Of course, that's a good thing if you love this scent. I sure don't.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2134992"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2134992#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2134717" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Also doesnt last long, it goes away in less than 2 hours.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2134544"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2134544#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2133953" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2133953" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="clarafragrance"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2098705"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2098705.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="clarafragrance" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Yves-Saint-Laurent/Libre-Eau-de-Toilette-65936.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.65936.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Libre Eau de Toilette"title="Libre Eau de Toilette"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2133953ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2133953" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2098705">clarafragrance</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-23">04/23/24 12:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>One of my favorite scents ever. VERY uplifting and happy while still being sophisticated. A definite compliment getter. I wear this in the summer and spring time. Signature scent worthy since the fruitiness is not overpowering. Its very well balanced, and has layers to it that Ive not seen in other fragrances. Very unique imo. Favorite from byredo - just before Gypsy water and Eleventh hour.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2133953"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2133953#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2132602" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2132602" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Swore"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1489447"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1489447.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Swore" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2132602ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2132602" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.79); This is because, for me, its the perfect bed scent. Calming, pleasant, not at all cloying, excellent for sleeping. <br />
<br />
Sometimes a scent is a masterwork despite all marks against it, in this case its performance and general generic-ness.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2132602"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2132602#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2131190" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
