Tart and fruity, smells a bit tropical to me. Growing up in a tropical country, I can never understand the western association of tropical with sunscreeny scents. This is what smells tropical to me because it smells like a fruit from back home, specifically the langsat. Not a love though, there is something a bit harsh and "cleaning product" ish in here, probably the citrus used.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2125684"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2125684#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2125157" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2125157" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Oxidia"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1670435"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Oxidia" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Acorelle/Velvet-Rose-66851.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.66851.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Velvet Rose"title="Velvet Rose"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2125157ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2125157" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1670435">Oxidia</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-15">04/15/24 04:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Guys. You guys. I avoided this brand because of the price, and got a bottle of this as a gift. <br />
I can't stop sniffing myself. It's such a light creamy lemony clean goodness. <br />
I don't like the usual blackcurrant in perfumes it makes it cloying for me, but this version is just....i can't stop sniffing myself. The citruses don't smell like toilet cleaner that bites your nose, which they usually do for me. <br />
I'm a gourmand hater, but this creamy scent is just divine.<br />
I reccomend this, trully what a wonderfull scent to own and wear.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2125157"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2125157#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2124854" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2124854" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="BandNerdChic"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/216191"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.216191.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="BandNerdChic" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.65738.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Orphon Eau de Parfum"title="Orphon Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2124854ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2124854" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/216191">BandNerdChic</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-14">04/14/24 17:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Unique, versatile, and enchanting. The clean, citrusy woods in here are made so interesting with dimension added by the fruity florals! This one feels like walking through a sunny forest into a field of purple wild flowers. It is somehow both a bold statement and extremely approachable. This is the perfume version of an Aviation cocktail.<br />
<br />
I love it on its own, but when I am feeling in a more unisex mood, I adore this layered. Try it over Byredo Sellier to add a leathery smoky depth, Tam Dao/Gaiac 10 to pull the woods in a drier direction, or Atelier Cologne Santal Carmin to add a creaminess to the woods.<br />
<br />
Scents tend to last very well on me, and I dont seem to have the same performance issues that others are mentioning, I can spray this in the morning and still enjoy wafts of it at the end of the work day. LOVE.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2124854"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2124854#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2123082" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2123082" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="VirgowithLeo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1408961"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1408961.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="VirgowithLeo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2123082ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2123082" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1408961">VirgowithLeo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-12">04/12/24 20:09</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I get aromatic vetiver I guess which I usually refer to as herbal earthy intense note like slow dance or TF rose chine etc (since idk how to describe it)<br />
<br />
And lot of lemony citrus notes<br />
Not my cup of tea</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2123082"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2123082#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2120773" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2120773" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Bea84"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2084998"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Bea84" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2120773ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2120773" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2084998">Bea84</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-10">04/10/24 16:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is such a beautiful soft scent. On my skin it smells like a creamy classy coconut? I can see why people say the Rare Beauty find comfort is similar but absolutely not a dupe. The RB one smells more citrus and vetiver and while I smell that in this perfume it is much creamier.<br />
<br />
But ZERO lasting power. Even my Jo Malone lasts longer than this. I could not smell even a hint of it after the first hour. Will not be purchasing a full bottle.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2120773"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2120773#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2118501" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1534907">sniffsmagee</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-04">04/04/24 22:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Cotton candy sweet, fresh, vibrant, uplifting. It smells like it sparkles. Unisex. I see people saying horrible performance but I sprayed 5 sprays on my shirt and got wiffs for over 15 hours. I was told that it couldn't be picked up from an arm's length after an hour so I would say that it's intimate but enjoyable. It's a linear fragrance which is awesome cuz it's smells like joy from the opening throughout. It could be more feminine leaning but I don't care this is beautiful</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2114750"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2114750#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2114700" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Its sweet, soapy, slightly sexy aroma is delightful. However, I do find it leans towards a more feminine scent profile. Not for me, but I'm eager to introduce it to my partner and hope I can enjoy it that way.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2111801"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2111801#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2111689" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2111689" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="kvnlzw"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1547326"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1547326.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="kvnlzw" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/BDK-Parfums/Tabac-Rose-61838.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.61838.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Tabac Rose"title="Tabac Rose"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2111689ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2111689" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1547326">kvnlzw</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-02">04/02/24 07:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Bal d'Afrique is a truly beautiful scent that makes you feel so good. It's basically sunshine and summer in a bottle with the most comforting creamy, citrusy-woody scent that I will reach for whenever I need a pick-me-up. At first sniff, I got mango sorbet and I was very surprised to find out that there's no mango in the notes!<br />
<br />
Downside is the hefty price tag and the longevity and projection could be so much better, as this is a very intimate scent. I hate that I love this scent so much.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2111689"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2111689#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2109999" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2109999" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ThetideGoesWithme"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2079008"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2079008.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ThetideGoesWithme" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2109999ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2109999" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76); The musk is too much and takes over quickly.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2109999"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2109999#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2108706" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2107971" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="miltonfragrance"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2057170"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2057170.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="miltonfragrance" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2107971ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2107971" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.73); Later dries down to a more woody, less sweet smell. <br />
One of my favorites from Byredo.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2107971"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2107971#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2107643" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1407258">*loves_shoes*</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-29">03/29/24 02:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>If youre not a perfume snob or purist, try layering this with Sol de Janeiro Cheriosa 68 as a body spray. <br />
<br />
Compliments all day. Insane projection. Beautiful scent. Could still smell the combination after 8 hours. <br />
<br />
I imagine BR540 or Cloud would have the same effect.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2107643"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2107643#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2102568" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2102568" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mooooo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2068697"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2068697.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="mooooo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2102568ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2102568" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2068697">mooooo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-24">03/24/24 08:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The perfume smells clean. It has these woody, floral, cocunut, undertones that balance out the citrusy chemical cleaning product smell. Its very pretty, and it lasts all day. For me this is a like not a love.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2102568"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2102568#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2101771" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1990330">Aquinabc</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-23">03/23/24 11:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Pleasant but I can only smell it 1 cm.away from it. Almost reminds of happy clinique .</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2101771"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2101771#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2101388" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2101388" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="11PHOSPHORUS11"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1179290"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1179290.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="11PHOSPHORUS11" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Chance-Parfum-31350.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31350.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Chance Parfum"title="Chance Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2101388ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2101388" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1179290">11PHOSPHORUS11</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-23">03/23/24 03:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have plenty of money in my beauty budget but Im not a snob and I like spending them wisely.<br />
<br />
So, when I think of a fragrance that Id be ready to spend this much money on, Im thinking of a bottle worth displaying in an art gallery. <br />
<br />
Then a clear identity of the company that released it, an ethos, a story that can be associated with the fragrance.<br />
<br />
Then the scent itself would have to be not just very good but superb, in every and any way. Amazing composition, great projection and evolution of all layers. Thats where the mastery of perfume-making can be organically discovered. You probably already know what I mean by now.<br />
<br />
Unfortunately very rarely a niche product can come anywhere close to that.<br />
<br />
I have ordered few samples from BYREDO and the experience was anticlimactic.<br />
<br />
Nothing was outstanding, everything is mediocre and their bottles are not something Id be eager to put at the forefront of my cabinet either.<br />
<br />
BYREDO therefore officially joined most of Tom Ford releases alongside Creeds and all the other ordinary creations that are simply not worth the money and a better quality can be acquired for less. <br />
<br />
Its a bit depressing that theres a market for ppl who want to spend  or even  for whatever reason and thats what theyre left to choose from. Im not one of them. At all.<br />
<br />
Good luck BYREDO!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2101388"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2101388#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2101290" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2101290" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Tshahb"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1579649"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1579649.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Tshahb" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Amouage/Journey-Man-25251.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.25251.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Journey Man"title="Journey Man"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2101290ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2101290" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1579649">Tshahb</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-22">03/22/24 22:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>What sounds like an interesting array of notes is totally obfuscated by heavy musk. On my skin a get loud, cloying musk and coconut, but I have to shove my nose into it to get the faintest suggestion of anything else. It's like aqua universalis painted over with musk so you can't smell it properly.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2101290"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2101290#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2100792" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2100792" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Poppy95"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1119554"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Poppy95" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jean-Paul-Gaultier/Classique-427.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.427.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Classique"title="Classique"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2100792ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2100792" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1119554">Poppy95</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-22">03/22/24 11:03</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Bal d'Afrique has haunted me ever since I first sampled it years ago. I was never all that into this kind of scent-profile, but there was just something about it that gave me life. On me it's all creamy, non-acidic, sweet lemon, vetiver and musk. Recently I sampled it once more. And I have thoughts.<br />
<br />
I am way more into these sorts of scents now that I was in the past. I used to think that there was no point in owning a perfume unless it was dark, deep and HEAVY - because if I wanted something skin-like (skin doesn't smell like lemon and marigold, I know, but I'm trying my best here), why not just... not wear any fragrance at all? But now... NOW. Now I find myself gravitating towards the likes of Glossier You, Another 13, and this (personal growth, we love to see it). Now I find that there is something so sexy about a fragrance that doesn't try to be sexy. And Bal d'Afrique doesn't try, it just IS. And it doesn't know just how appealing it is - which is just so charming, isn't it?<br />
<br />
What I'm TRYING to say with this word-vomity wall of text is this: Bal d'Afrique is gorgeous in a carefree, quietly luxurious way. You know how perfumes can put you in a certain mood? You spritz it on, and think "okay, life doesn't suck THAT bad". Bal d'Afrique makes my monkey-brain go "heh. I love my life". It's my ultimate "no thoughts just vibes" fragrance, and as someone who is prone to overthinking and having "neurosis" as my baseline on the daily, I mean this as a compliment of the highest degree. And for these vibes, I am willing to pay the (ungodly) price :)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2100792"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2100792#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2099919" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2099919" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Steph_DSXO"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1417967"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1417967.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Steph_DSXO" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Mugler/Angel-704.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.704.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Angel"title="Angel"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2099919ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2099919" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1417967">Steph_DSXO</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-21">03/21/24 15:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is one of those fragrances where you cant quite put your finger on what youre smelling straight away<br />
I got a free sample of this, read the notes and thought doesnt sound like me but gave it a spray and nothing like I was expecting! I get coconut and pineapple somehow like a cocktail but mixed with green and a powdery note. <br />
It was love at first spray! The original spray stayed true on me and didnt settle into anything different.<br />
While I can see this possibly being unisex on me it leans more feminine.<br />
I wore it to a birthday recently and got so many compliments on it! What are you wearing? Its soooo nice! Ive never smelt anything like it before!<br />
Its def up in my faves now and while I feel its more suited to warmer weather as its somehow clean and sweet at the same time, not nauseating in the Australian summer like a lot of fragrances, I think you could get away with it in cooler temps to.<br />
Love! But oh so expensive!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2099919"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2099919#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2098246" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2098246" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="denisa_iv"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1252395"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="denisa_iv" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/Oud-Satin-Mood-30352.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.30352.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Oud Satin Mood"title="Oud Satin Mood"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2098246ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2098246" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1252395">denisa_iv</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-20">03/20/24 07:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I don't think Byredo is my house after trying a few of their perfumes. Had high hopes for this one, but as usual it doesn't last, doesn't project and even in the first 30 minutes that I can smell it on myself I don't like it at all. It's a fragrance that's not hard to wear, I see why a lot of people wouldn't mind it. But love it? I don't know, I don't.<br />
It's a mix of spices and woody notes, maybe citrusy but not in fresh way. There's also a note I clearly dislike, I'm trying to understand if it's vetiver. I like it in bath products, but a few fragrances I tried and didn't like had this note, so maybe it just doesn't work in a fragrance for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2090380" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Melody Valentine"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1747732"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Melody Valentine" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/By-Kilian/Love-Don-t-Be-Shy-4322.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4322.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Love Don't Be Shy"title="Love Don't Be Shy"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2090380ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2090380" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1747732">Melody Valentine</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-12">03/12/24 11:39</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>No, I kinda knew I wouldn't like this tbh. I find it extremely boring and light but I didn't think I'd like Gypsy Water as much as I do, and I've got a sample of Lil Fleur which I quite like, so I decided to try this anyway and I was right from the start. I can see why it'd be nice as a hotel shower gel and shampoo etc coz it's definitely unisex, bordering on the masculine side and most hotel shampoos do smell like that, but as a perfume I don't like it. It's too sharp and herbal for me, and I nearly always hate blackcurrant or blackberry notes in perfume. I don't find it aromatic, just herbal. Aromatic to me is something like Dolce and Gabbana red cap with the basil and spices or even G Water. I'd probably like it on a man but even then there's hundreds of men's scents I'd rather smell on a guy. Thankfully, for me, it doesn't last two seconds. For how much this costs it's insane how terrible the performance is.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2090380"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2090380#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2090281" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2090281" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="headkace"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2054601"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2054601.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="headkace" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Kerosene/Unknown-Pleasures-17438.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.17438.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Unknown Pleasures"title="Unknown Pleasures"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2090281ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2090281" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2054601">headkace</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-12">03/12/24 10:30</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I never would have found this scent if it wasn't for a hotel i was staying at in Atlanta once. It was the scent of the bath products they provided. I fell in love with it. I immediately went and bought a bottle of the perfume at the mall nearby in Buckhead. It's a clean scent but not headache inducing. It's rich and fresh and borderline creamy, fruity.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2090281"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2090281#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2083851" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2083851" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="srimamm30"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1865251"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="srimamm30" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2083851ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2083851" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1865251">srimamm30</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-06">03/06/24 04:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>a year round scent, easily a 10/10 in the current perfume scene(everything clean and aesthetic). It feels like taking a hot shower during cold winter mornings in a expensive hotel bathroom which has a wooden floor and has a view of snowy mountains .Theres something about this scent which is clean but theres still that creaminess and warmth which makes it different from other clean perfumes. i wore this throughout the winter and i can absolutely see myself loving this in summer as well.And no its not the screechy lemony clean scent</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2083851"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2083851#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2078936" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2078936" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="James_Alberts"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2038363"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2038363.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="James_Alberts" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2078936ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2078936" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2038363">James_Alberts</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-01">03/01/24 08:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Wearing Bal d'Afrique by Byredo has been like taking a step back in time to 1920s Paris, with its rich blend of cultures and art. The scent captures something deeply nostalgic yet incredibly modern, making it a fascinating paradox in a bottle. It's not just the unique blend of notes that draws me in but the story it tellsof a Paris enamored with African culture, of nights filled with music and dance, and of an artistic fervor that knew no bounds.<br />
<br />
This fragrance has a way of standing out, not just for its scent but for the aura it creates around you. It's like wearing a piece of history, yet it fits so seamlessly into the present day. Bal d'Afrique has become more than just a part of my fragrance collection; it's a daily reminder of creativity, exploration, and the timeless beauty of cultural fusion. Each time I wear it, I'm impressed by its depth and the way it manages to capture such a vibrant era with elegance and a touch of mystery.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2078936"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2078936#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2078876" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2078876" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jadepo21"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1289078"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1289078.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="jadepo21" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Ex-Nihilo/Lust-in-Paradise-53588.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.53588.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Lust in Paradise"title="Lust in Paradise"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2078876ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2078876" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.9); It's like a floor cleaner - super citrusy and lemon forward. Pledge is not my preferred personal scent, so gonna be a hard pass on this one.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2078876"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2078876#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2078600" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2027816">barta.bart</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-01">03/01/24 00:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I don't understand the hype. This smells nice for the first few seconds before it dries and then smells like nice soap and fresh laundry. Not a scent id pay this much for, it doesn't last more than 3 to 4 hours on my skin or my clothes. I'm not a huge fan of fresh scents to begin with mostly because they just don't last.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2078600"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2078600#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2076953" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2076953" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Ainghardt"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1441634"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1441634.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Ainghardt" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/The-7-Virtues/Vanilla-Woods-52560.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.52560.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Vanilla Woods"title="Vanilla Woods"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2076953ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2076953" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1441634">Ainghardt</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-28">02/28/24 11:33</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This was my signature scent for like 6 years. It's so beautiful. It's warm and creamy and at the same time sparkly, clean and fruity (I get a lot of pineapple). Really unique in my opinion. Sadly it lasts like two hours on the skin and it's way too expensive to defend that. If it had logevity I would almost never wear anything else. Still love it, but now I stick to the body lotion, that actually lasts longer </p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2076953"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2076953#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2075471" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2075471" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Ash212"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1180397"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1180397.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Ash212" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2075471ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2075471" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1180397">Ash212</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-27">02/27/24 03:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Got a selection of bal d'afrique, blanche, &amp; gypsy water. I was familiar with bal d'afrique but in comparison to gypsy water, it smelt a little like lemon cleaner. It lacks subtleness to it and is in your face. However, gypsy water was a little coying and I feel like the longer you have it on the dirtier it might get. <br />
<br />
Bal d'afrique is clean and screeching but it does settle down to something smoother and more complex. It has that warm quality often found in vanilla scents but not too warm, just a radiating subtle fragrance thats smooth. It's not only unisex but can likely be worn in all seasons. It's foremost clean and fresh especially with the lemon... but still has a warmth to it as explained which would really shine in the cooler months. It was 35 degree celsius today and it felt right on after a shower &amp; even later on in the cooler evening. It feels like a luxury clean scent to me. I like it!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2075471"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2075471#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2074635" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; I love how complex it is, but still very light and refreshing. It smells like a refreshing beverage youre ordering in a jungle bar where you can also smell a wet woody notes around you. Nice, but Im also getting a bit of cleaning products vibe from orange blossom, so I cant say I love it.<br />
<br />
Follow me on IG: scent.guide</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2074635"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2074635#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2074569" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
