padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1440667">shoujomarina</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-26">02/26/24 07:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>oh my. its really pretty! i think i prefer this to G water. its a more well rounded version, though you  still get that  herbally, piney lemon violet vibe here. its blended well, multidimensional. a mix of florals, earthiness, cleanliness. someone said luxury lotion and thats pretty spot on. its a more unique take on an everyday scent, not basic! for all ages 25 and up! i could see my grandma wearing this or even a grandpa if he wanted something floral.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2074569"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2074569#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2072268" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2072268" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Heliotrope72"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1951661"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1951661.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Heliotrope72" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Amouage/Love-Tuberose-50889.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.50889.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Love Tuberose"title="Love Tuberose"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2072268ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2072268" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1951661">Heliotrope72</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-24">02/24/24 01:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Rating: <br />
Do I like it: Meh<br />
Who it is: A very obsessively - compulsively anxious perfectionist on a vacation that they got mandated time off and now is pretending to be on vacation when in reality they are secretly working from home<br />
Smells I get: coconut milk, pineapple, cedar, soapy accord<br />
Meyer's Briggs type: ISTJ (on a mandated vacation)<br />
<br />
Probably the first Byredo that I actually quite like.<br />
<br />
A tad sweet, bit fruity, bit acetonic and overall confusing. if I ignore the official notes I get coconut milk/cream, pineapple and distant floral fabric softener, along with a whiff of acetone that resides in all Byredo's perfumes.<br />
<br />
If I look at the actual notes above, I'd say I can pick out a sweet blackcurrant, lemon and a some cedar and amber. The rest is a flowery, herbaceous bouquet where I can't pick out anything in particular.<br />
<br />
It's inoffensive, fresh, undecided but interesting. Basically a more unique synthetic tropical take on a soapy scent. Wouldn't give more than 30$ for it, though.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2072268"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2072268#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2069231" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2069231" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Msala140"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1787860"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1787860.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Msala140" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dior/Dior-Addict-Eau-de-Parfum-2014-28201.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.28201.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Dior Addict Eau de Parfum (2014)"title="Dior Addict Eau de Parfum (2014)"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2069231ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2069231" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1787860">Msala140</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-21">02/21/24 06:05</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Smells like a beautiful, high end lotion . I get a good blend of lemon and florals Ive never laid my nose on in real life but I guess that is the tagete and cyclamen . The vetiver is very soft , and the cedar is very light on the sown just in the background . Overall feels very zen like something I would smell at a spa .its calming, lotion like and beautiful . Im in FL so hearing how the performance of this was terrible so I was concerned but it seems to preform well in the heat. On skin it kept projecting like 4 hours but I smelled it on my clothes and test strip the following day .</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2069231"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2069231#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2068575" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2068575" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="SleepCat"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2024382"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="SleepCat" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2068575ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2068575" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2024382">SleepCat</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-20">02/20/24 14:09</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Smelled super synthetic to me, like some kind of peach candy. Sadly don't understand the hype.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2068575"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2068575#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2068465" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2068465" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="magred"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1830185"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1830185.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="magred" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2068465ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2068465" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1830185">magred</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-20">02/20/24 12:27</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>when i smell something very hyped, for better or for worse, i can usually tell what it is that stood out so much about it to make it so popular. bal d'afrique has to be the most underwhelming of those experiences thus far. i literally have no idea why this gets the accolades it does. there's nothing wrong with it, if i had to describe it it would be as a generic idk fresh/floral scent. but it's too weak to /really/ be anything. not just weak in sillage/longevity (though it's nonexistent there too) but weak in character. this scent says nothing to me. and i'm a freshie fan! such a weird phenomenon around this one.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2068465"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2068465#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2068179" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2068179" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Cherryz"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1932468"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Cherryz" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lancome/La-Vie-est-Belle-L-Elixir-95856.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.95856.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="La Vie est Belle L'Elixir"title="La Vie est Belle L'Elixir"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2068179ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2068179" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1932468">Cherryz</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-20">02/20/24 08:06</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is the most interesting fragrance I've ever tried. Extremely well blended. My brain is going round and round like this: "What is it? Remember anything like it? Any connections at all? Not quite there yet? Ok, time to sniff again". <br />
<br />
It reminds me of summertime and vacations, but at the same time it is grounding, elegant and mysterious. My first thoughts are that I smell cacti! I remember eating prickly pears in Mexico - very fresh, a bit sweet and sour. Or maybe it smells like freshly cut aloe vera with sweet lemons and something... sth I will probably never be able to decipher. After it has dried a bit, the only notes I can distinguish from this intoxicating concoction are pineapples with a hint of coconut and cream. I feel like I should open the parasol to avoid sunburn, but when I look out the window I realize it's dark and slippery outside as it's the middle of February right now.<br />
<br />
Edit: I went ahead and tried a dupe, Emir Vibrant Vetiver Delight. Be smarter than me and don't buy it, specially if you like more feminine scents. It smells like a citrus aftershave with zero depth and complexity. There's no cream, no comfy-feeling anything.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2068179"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2068179#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2066530" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2066530" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="shannabrowder"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1045088"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="shannabrowder" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2066530ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2066530" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1045088">shannabrowder</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-18">02/18/24 17:32</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I got a Byredo sample box, and this scent was an instant like. It reminded me of another scent, but I couldnt figure it out.<br />
And then it hit me. <br />
Versace Yellow Diamond. Its not a dupe, but they are very similar on my skin.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2066530"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2066530#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2064977" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2064977" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="SuurkaalsPoeten"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1912350"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="SuurkaalsPoeten" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.6458.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bal d'Afrique"title="Bal d'Afrique"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2064977ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2064977" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1912350">SuurkaalsPoeten</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-17">02/17/24 05:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>IMO this smells almost identical to the original KAOS for women from GOSH. I had expected something more edgy, thrilling and slightly mysterious - mainly because of the vibe that the name gives me. <br />
It does have a bit more nerve than KAOS in the first hour or so which, according to me, is a good thing. I find KAOS to be soapy, leaning to a bit sickly, heavy and most of all linear. This has some sort of itchy rough component in the background at the beginning. Maybe it's the wood. Unfortunately I don't get fruits nor vetiver nor the summery vibe - I think it would have made it much more interesting. The way it performs on my skin I would not wear this in warm weather.<br />
I was surprised that coconut isnt in the formula - it really has a coconutty smell that to me is very prominent during the first half hour. On my skin it quickly evolved into an ultrasoft, kinda dull, skinscent only consisting of musk and maybe a tiny hint of the floral notes. So it didnt perform very long and abruptly went from sort-of-exciting to what I would define as a soapy Granny-scent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2064977"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2064977#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2064466" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2064466" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="NataliePee"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1563905"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="NataliePee" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lush/Bridgerton-92675.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.92675.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bridgerton"title="Bridgerton"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2064466ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2064466" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1563905">NataliePee</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-16">02/16/24 13:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Dichotomous because on one hand it evokes luxury and excess (5-star hotels, plush bathrobes, an afternoon at the spa) and on the other hand it smells like a middle-class suburban childhood (helping mom hang laundry on the line, Snuggles the bear, washing up with Dial anti-bacterial handsoap) Beautiful but fleeting. <br />
<br />
I think the type of person to wear this scent is clean, and crisp. Someone who irons their bedsheets. If you're inclined to like dirtier frags with musky/earthy notes this might give you the feeling that you just Febrezed yourself.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2064466"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2064466#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2059999" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2059999" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Ljena777"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1850694"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1850694.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Ljena777" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2059999ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2059999" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1850694">Ljena777</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-12">02/12/24 09:03</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Very underwhelmed with that one. I loved it at first, I put it on my I want it list. Ive tried to wear it today and oh my, I have a headache from it. It smells like some heavy soap, its making me nauseous. Quite disappointed, I was so close to buy it just after trying it out once. Would have been a huge mistake. Also, the longevity is very weak for the price, so thats another disadvantage.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2059999"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2059999#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2058428" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2058428" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="StinkySally"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/495531"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.495531.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="StinkySally" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Givenchy/Amarige-3.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.3.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Amarige"title="Amarige"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2058428ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2058428" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/495531">StinkySally</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-10">02/10/24 16:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Can anyone say what the buttery note is? It came out from the start and it lingers! What, pray tell, is this note?</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2058428"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2058428#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2054054" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; This would be perfect to wear after a nice morning shower on a sunny spring day (that's the vibe I'm getting although this could be worn pretty much anytime). Unfortunately, the lasting power is a huge disappointment compared to the price point! Idk if I can justify buying a full bottle, and these never seem to be on discount either  // Ehh, I know I will at some point. The scent is just too lovely.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="2052714"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=2052714#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2051695" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Love it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="743199"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=743199#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1537350" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1537350" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Idismee"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1168396"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1168396.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Idismee" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Profumum-Roma/Sorriso-21853.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.21853.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sorriso"title="Sorriso"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1537350ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1537350" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1168396">Idismee</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-04-05">04/05/22 10:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Let me open this review by saying that Ive never been a summer girl. My absolute favorite notes when it comes to perfume reflect this: cozy, gourmand, boozy, smoky, spicy... Ive always been more drawn to mysterious &amp; yummy autumn/winter scents<br />
<br />
However, when I first encountered Bal dAfrique by chance at a Byredo counter in Amsterdam, my entire thinking around summer scents changed. Here was an unmistakably summery scent, with all the attributes I had once associated with autumn/winter scents!<br />
<br />
Every one of my favorite perfumes has an accompanying song in my mind, and for Bal dAfrique, its I Love Hot Nights by Jonathan Richman &amp; The Modern Lovers. Whenever I wear this, I am instantly transported to Morocco, in a bustling outdoor night market, surrounded by stalls full of fruits, incense, and spices the midday heat is still clinging to the evening air and I can feel the cool sheen of sweat on the nape of my neck theres music, laughter, dancing, shop owners loudly beckoning passers-by I feel the evening breeze caress my body upwards from under my summer dress... My head is spinning with colors and sounds and heat and magic<br />
<br />
 I always get a little carried away describing how I experience Bal dAfrique.<br />
<br />
Theres a definite prominent pineapple note (surprised it isnt listed at all), but what truly brings it all together for me is vetiver base. This is, in my opinion, what separates Bal dAfrique from other fruity summer perfumes - it adds a mysterious earthy quality that makes you feel as through youre surrounded by something ancient and sacred I dont know how exactly to explain it. I have both the full bottle and the roll-on, which is a summer handbag staple for me. Sillage is excellent, and it lasts all day on my skin. To this day, its the only scent that can instantly make me yearn for July.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="1537350"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=1537350#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1024151" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1024151" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Muchacho"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1078497"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1078497.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Muchacho" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Burberry/Mr-Burberry-Eau-de-Parfum-43525.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.43525.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum"title="Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1024151ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1024151" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1078497">Muchacho</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-01-24">01/24/19 22:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>If I could own only one fragrance it would be this one right here. Bal d'Afrique is a perfect blend fruitiness, sweetness, and florals making is wearable anytime and anywhere. This scent works for me in the cold too. It's definitely the fragrance I reach for the most and will eventually buy a second bottle.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="1024151"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=1024151#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1635982" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1635982" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ewaba"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/326639"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="ewaba" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Cacharel/Catch-Me-15356.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.15356.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Catch...Me"title="Catch...Me"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1635982ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1635982" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/326639">ewaba</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-09-01">09/01/22 14:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a beautiful everyday scent. To me it smells of lemons and milk. It evokes feelings of happiness and safety.  Very soft but quite unique.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="1635982"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=1635982#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent712749" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc712749" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Sue Oakhill"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/957908"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.957908.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Sue Oakhill" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma712749ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd712749" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/957908">Sue Oakhill</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-06-07">06/07/16 07:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>LOVE LOVE LOVE... This is the first perfume EVER (in the 40 years of my life and the probably 25 years I'm using perfumes), which I bought on the same day of smelling it for the first time... the first time ever that a recommendation of a shop assistant was spot on.... and the first time, a perfume became my signature scent straight away. I smelled it and it was just... me. <br />
<br />
I was on a lunch break hunt for new scents and had a chat in the shop about my current favorites (normally fresh white flowers with a green touch, since recently also more woody and deeper/more masculine scents, but never too powdery, makes me cough)...<br />
The assistant showed me Bal d'Afrique... I smelled it for the first time... and went "Mmmmmh!" immediately... not like oftentimes, when you politely answer "Yes, nice..." or  "Mhm, not bad..." to those awful scents some of the shop assistants are recommending, with the words "I like it very much myself!" or "This is very popular!".<br />
<br />
No, Bal d'Afrique has a wonderfully fresh citrus/orange/bergamot blast in the beginning, interlaced with a delicious fruit (must be the blackcurrant), never getting sickly sweet, never acidly citric (you know... like the times when you have to sneeze from all the citrus)... just a wonderful balance between all components... while a faint smokey touch is hovering at the scent's edges.<br />
<br />
This initial richness of juicy fruits lasts about 20 minutes on my skin and then fades a little, becoming warmer with amber, musk and cedar. The smokey touch also gets a little stronger, but never becomes disgusting (non-smoker writing here). <br />
<br />
The only "drop of bitterness" in this luscious composition is... longevity is only moderate... after 2-3 hours I barely can smell it anymore on myself. Be prepared to always take it with you to refreshen it after some time, because you just can't live without it. Sillage is weak, so it's very office friendly and wearable too. <br />
<br />
Bal d'Afrique is like nothing I've ever smelled before. The scent invokes a feeling of the zest for life and indulging in its pleasures, while the deeper - and sometimes smokey - layers of your experience of life are always present in the background... not disturbing the present, but also never being forgotten. The picture of a unique life.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="712749"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=712749#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="6458" sentiment="positive"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-negative-reviews"><div class="cell">

This is a big pass from me!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="1272529"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=1272529#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1340949" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1343082">sophiafinley</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-07-27">07/27/21 20:05</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I'm new to perfume and might just have a poor scent identifying skill, but all I got was lemon windex :(</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="1382594"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=1382594#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent469803" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc469803" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="spidola"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/524549"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.524549.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="spidola" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Andrea-Maack/Silk-13281.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.13281.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Silk"title="Silk"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma469803ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd469803" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/524549">spidola</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-03-25">03/25/14 07:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This perfume is like a beautiful wooden tray with colorful exotic fruits You have to love both  woods and fruits for admire this joyful scent.<br />
It opens with really pleasant, fresh, wooden, citrusy smell -  like a wind in Amazonia. Thats the most beautiful part for my nose, but it lasts only 10 minutes. Then it settles down and you can smell sweet fruits. Its strange, that there is only blackcurrant as a fruit  I was sure to see a lot of tropical fruits among the notes. The concentration of it must be elevate. And as I do not like blackcurrant and fruity notes in general, I do not enjoy Bal dAfrique  so much anymore. But I think its a nice composition and gives positive feelings, so I suggest to give it a try  it could be great for summer time.<br />
<br />
Longevity 5 hours.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="469803"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=469803#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1012809" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1012809" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="otspiii"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1176587"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1176587.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="otspiii" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Xerjoff/Dhajala-6304.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.6304.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Dhajala"title="Dhajala"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1012809ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1012809" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1176587">otspiii</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-12-23">12/23/18 19:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A strong daiquiri on a vacation where you still have to check in on your laptop. This started out with a powerful and attention grabbingly citrus that put me in The Lemon Zone.<br />
<br />
Maybe because it's so citrus-centric, it faded extremely quickly into something much more subtle and floral and less interesting. I liked the top notes, but don't have much of an opinion on what the perfume spends most of its life as.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6458"comment_id="1012809"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html?ccid=1012809#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="6458" sentiment="negative"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>

                 data-sticky

                <!-- Tag ID: fragranticacom_perfume_vrec_1 -->
<div class="freeStarFragrantica" align="center" data-freestar-ad="__300x600" id="fragranticacom_perfume_vrec_1" v-pre>
</div>
            </div>
                <div style="clear:both; height: 1rem;"></div>
    
</div>
    </div>
</div>                        <div id="popBrands" class="strike-title" style="margin-top: 4em;"><span>Most Popular Perfumes</span></div>
            <div class="grid-x grid-margin-y grid-margin-x text-center">
        <div class="cell small-4 medium-2 flex-container flex-dir-column">
        <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 2.9em; overflow: hidden;">
        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">1.&nbsp;</span>

                if (lang == 'NL') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.nl").replace(/designers/, "ontwerper").replace(/perfume/, "parfum") });
                if (lang == 'SR') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.punmiris.com").replace(/designers/, "dizajner").replace(/perfume/, "parfem") });
                if (lang == 'RO') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.ro").replace(/designers/, "creatori").replace(/perfume/, "parfum") });
                if (lang == 'AR') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragranticarabia.com").replace(/perfume/, "perfumes") });
                if (lang == 'UK') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.ua").replace(/perfume/, "perfumes") });
                if (lang == 'MN') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.mn").replace(/perfume/, "perfumes") });
                if (lang == 'HE') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.co.il").replace(/perfume/, "perfumes") });
            });
</script>


<script  data-cfasync="false">
    // Check that service workers are supported
    if ('serviceWorker' in navigator) {
        // Use the window load event to keep the page load performant
        window.addEventListener('load', () => {
            navigator.serviceWorker.register('/service-worker.js?v=rtgH0e5cbbe5e5f689826b719ace22a5b2a11');
        });
    }
</script>
<script>
    $(document).ready(function () {
        $('#fragranticaloader').fadeOut(20);
    });
</script>
</body>
</html>
